newsitem.title: SINGAPORE: Fire at Mobil Singapore extinguished, no injuries.
newsitem.headline: Fire at Mobil Singapore extinguished, no injuries.

text.p: Firefighters extinguished an early morning fire on Tuesday at Mobil Oil Singapore's 280,000 barrel-per-day (bpd) refinery, the Singapore Civil Defense Force (SCDF) said in a statement.
There were no deaths and injuries reported, it said.

The fire which broke out at 0800 hours (0000GMT) involved a large quantity of oil in the production area at Mobil's refinery at No 18. Pioneer Road in Jurong, on the west coast of Singapore, the statement said.
It said it took 27 minutes to extinguished the fire.
A spokesman from SCDF said the department is currently investigating the cause of the fire with Mobil.
This is the third incident at the refinery since it was shut on March 15 for maintenance and debottlenecking to raise its capacity to 300,000 bpd.
On Monday, one man died and six were injured after a gas leak at the refinery's aromatics plant.
Last week, another fire had broken out at the Jurong refinery but was put out within five minutes.
The refinery spokeman did not comment on how the fire would affect the restart of refinery.
